result.execSummary:
The defendant Mindy A. Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mindy A. Vasquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mindy A. Vasquez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Ben Schwarz for Atty Kristyne Watson.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct2 - found guilty by the court. Ct1 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Court orders a $50 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or civil judgment.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal rights given.
Spoke with Katie @ KJS @ 0846.
Final pre-trial on August 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Watson is requesting 11/9/2015 Final pre-trial be rescheduled - DE needs time to get her driver's license by completing counseling with HOPE Council.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 1/21/2016 at 1:30pm.  Parties notified in court.
